channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1368; 07:50PM; 1030 W Alpine St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3WPhoM2" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3WPhoM2</a>; #Chinatown; Firefighters arrived to find a vacant residential dwelling with heavy fire showing. This structure had burned previously and was already ventilated from past firefighting operations, therefore the 32 responding LAFD firefighters were able to effectively extinguish the flames from the exterior in 16 minutes, without injury. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC11 BC2 E20 E203 E220 E3 E4 RA20 RA803 SO1 SQ21 T20 T3; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1368; 07:34PM; 1030 W Alpine St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/48ZcXkd" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/48ZcXkd</a>; #Chinatown; *Address Tentative* One-story single-family home with heavy fire showing.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC11 BC2 E20 E203 E220 E3 E4 RA20 RA803 SQ21 T20 T3; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0986; 03:32PM; 2301 S Federal Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3KdoyCa" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3KdoyCa</a>; #Sawtelle; Firefighters responded to a one-story commercial with smoke showing. A large industrial structure had a stubborn attic fire deep into the structure. It took 38 firefighters 31 minutes to extinguish the flames, without injury. The cause is under investigation.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC18 BC4 BC9 CM40 CM42 E237 E263 E37 E43 E59 E62 EA1 EM9 RA59 RA62 RA892 SO1 T37 T63 T92; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0986; 03:01PM; 2301 S Federal Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3KdoyCa" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3KdoyCa</a>; #Sawtelle; One-story commercial building with light smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC18 BC4 BC9 CM40 CM42 E237 E263 E37 E43 E59 E62 EM9 RA59 RA62 RA892 T37 T63 T92; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0357; 08:24AM; 11976 W Culver Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3yuVkw1" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3yuVkw1</a>; #DelRey; Forty-two LAFD firefighters, along with Culver City FD, responded to a four-story modern apartment complex, where fire in one third-floor unit was held in check by an automatic fire sprinkler. Firefighters promptly extinguished the remaining flames and shut down the fire sprinkler. Approximately a dozen people were evacuated do to excessive water in the building, which successfully prevented the fire from advancing throughout the residential structure. Crews will remain on scene for an extended period of time to dewater the affected areas. Thankfully, there were no reported injuries. The cause is under investigation.; FS 62; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 BC9 CM52 E205 E263 E43 E62 E63 E67 RA59 RA62 RA862 SO1 T5 T63 T92; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 05/24/2024 INC#0111

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0111; 03:18AM; 1001 E 27th St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3yqbQNJ" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3yqbQNJ</a>; #HistoricSouthCentral; Firefighters arrived to find a vacant church building (site of a previous burn) fully involved with fire. Crews developed hose lines from the exterior, in defensive mode, due to the uncertain structural stability of the dilapidated building, which sustained partial collapses at times during the fire fight. Ultimately, it took 66 firefighters 38 minutes to complete extinguishment of the intense flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E203 E209 E21 E210 E221 E3 E9 EM11 HR3 RA14 RA3 RA803 RA814 SO1 SQ21 T10 T21 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0111; 02:40AM; 1001 E 27th St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3VdWKEc" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3VdWKEc</a>; #HistoricSouthCentral; Firefighters are battling heavy flames at a two-story vacant church. Defensive mode.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E203 E209 E21 E210 E221 E3 E9 EM11 HR3 RA14 RA3 RA803 RA814 SO1 SQ21 T10 T21 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Multi-Patient Traffic Collision; INC#0999; 04:15PM; 14961 W Hubbard St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L</a>; #Sylmar; Four vehicle traffic collision with one vehicle overturned. No entrapment. *Eight patients* total. 2 declined hospital transport. Six patients were taken to area hospitals by LAFD Paramedics: Two adults in serious condition, 4 children (ages 6-12) with minor injuries. Though seatbelts were used, some of the children were improperly restrained (No car seats in use, at least two children sharing one seat belt). Thankfully, none of the passengers were ejected from the vehicle(s). Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #2925). "As we enter this Memorial Day weekend, the Los Angeles Fire Department joins law enforcement officials in reminding you to drive sober, avoid distractions, follow speed limits and always buckle up. If you see an impaired driver, call 9-1-1 immediately."; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E18 E287 E298 E7 E75 EM12 EM14 EM15 EM5 RA107 RA75 RA828 RA89 RA891 RA898 RA91 RA96 RA98 T75 T87 T98; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Multi-Patient Traffic Collision; INC#0999; 02:58PM; 14961 W Hubbard St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bU7z3L</a>; #Sylmar; PRELIM: Multi-vehicle traffic collision with as many as nine patients.; FS 75; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E7 E75 EM14 EM15 EM5 RA107 RA75 RA828 RA89 RA898 RA891 RA91 RA98 T75; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#0396; 08:31AM; Tujunga Wash; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/ULndatrrrN8bsh948" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/ULndatrrrN8bsh948</a>; #ShadowHills; PRELIM: LAFD ground crews assisting LAPD Foothill Division (Incident #1277) and Medical Examiner with the recovery of a person discovered deceased (undetermined age / gender / body condition / affiliation / circumstances) by a hiker in remnant floodwater along a remote section of the Tujunga Wash flood control channel. No further details.; FS 24; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; E274 E275 EM12 RA74 T74; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey
